result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig K. Burr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
APPLY BOND
Fine and costs to be paid at time of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 419, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

with Good Time.  With HUBER if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  No HUBER for failure to report.    Defendant to report in PERSON to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentencing with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application in order to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig K. Burr

records.addlTxt: Defendant Craig K. Burr in court with attorney Richard E. Bollenbeck.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Richard E. Bollenbeck in court.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 09:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
